answers.q: what is a dangerously low oxygen level
answers.a: An oxygen saturation (SpO2) below 90% is generally considered dangerously low and warrants urgent evaluation; on arterial blood gas, a PaO2 below about 60 mmHg indicates hypoxemia.

answers.q: how many valence electrons does oxygen have
how to increase blood oxygen level
answers.a: Move to fresh, well-ventilated air, sit upright, and practice slow deep breathing; avoid smoking and address underlying lung or heart conditions. If levels remain low, seek medical careâ€”supplemental oxygen should only be used as prescribed.

answers.q: how many electrons does oxygen have
answers.a: A neutral oxygen atom has 8 electrons.

answers.q: how much oxygen is in the air
answers.a: Dry air is about 20.9% oxygen by volume (roughly 21%).
